text:
PrintPay

Problem Statement: In many educational institutions, students face significant challenges when printing documents due to long queues, slow file transfers caused by poor internet connectivity, and payment issues. These inefficiencies lead to unnecessary delays and frustration for students who need quick access to printed materials.

Similarly, print shop managers and administrators require an efficient system to manage file transfers, payments, and secure document collection, reducing manual workload and enhancing operational efficiency.



Objective: The primary objective of PrintPay is to automate and streamline the document printing process by integrating hardware and software solutions. The system will facilitate seamless file transfers, secure and automated document retrieval, and hassle-free payments for both students and printing shop managers.



Developing Procedure: The PrintPay system consists of two main components: hardware and software.

Hardware:

The system will use RFID-based technology, where each student or user is assigned an RFID card.

Each print collection box is equipped with an RFID reader.

When a user taps their RFID card, the assigned box unlocks, allowing document retrieval.

Software:

A web application developed using React.js for the frontend and React Native for mobile compatibility.

Users can transfer documents via WhatsApp to the administrator’s number.

An automation tool (Selenium) will handle document processing and ensure that each print is placed in a specific assigned box.

The system generates a unique box number synchronized with the RFID card.

Payment integration will be included to enable seamless transactions through various digital payment methods(RazorPay).











Requirements:

Frontend: React.js, React Native

Hardware: RFID Reader, ESP32

Automation: Selenium

Design: Figma



Patent Considerations:

Innovative Approach:

Automating the entire document printing and retrieval process using RFID-based authentication.

Synchronizing box numbers with RFID authentication for secure document collection.

Integrating WhatsApp-based document transfers and automated printing.

Technical Uniqueness:

The combination of RFID-based secure box opening with automated document handling.

Payment integration to eliminate the need for physical cash transactions.

Web and mobile app support for ease of access.

User Benefits:

Eliminates long queues for students.

Ensures secure and efficient document retrieval.

Reduces manual workload for print shop managers.
